content.text:
In order to assess the preventive and immunological effects of the newly developed hepatitis A vaccine, 7-year-old susceptible children in a village were immunised with the hepatitis A vaccine. After 3 years of follow-up observation, the results were as follows.<image 1> The main outcome of the study was

A. Incidence of hepatitis A
B. Prevalence of hepatitis A
C. Secondary attack rate of hepatitis A
D. Survival rate of hepatitis A

The main outcome of the study is the incidence of hepatitis A.

Incidence refers to the number of new cases of a disease that occur in a specific population during a defined time period. In this case, the study is assessing the number of new cases of hepatitis A in the vaccination group and the control group over a 3-year follow-up period.

Therefore, the correct answer is:

A. Incidence of hepatitis A
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
